title: Repair build/runtime issues and relabel Gallery as Portfolio while preserving /gallery

requirements.summary: Fix build/runtime failures by correcting route-safe UI code and ensuring all referenced static asset paths resolve (no TS/routing/404 asset issues).
acceptanceCriteria: `npm`/build pipeline completes successfully with no TypeScript errors.
App loads all routes (`/`, `/about`, `/vision-mission`, `/services`, `/gallery`, `/contact`) without blank screens or uncaught exceptions.
Browser console shows no uncaught errors on initial load and while navigating to the Gallery/Portfolio page.
All referenced static assets used by the UI (logo, hero background, gallery images) resolve to valid paths (no 404s for `/assets/...`).

file_operations.description: Audit and correct gallery item `path` values so every referenced image exists under the public assets folder (prefer generated clean images when available, otherwise fall back to existing local originals). Ensure there are no references to non-existent `/assets/generated/...` files that would cause 404s and broken gallery/lightbox rendering.

Verify and, if needed, update logo asset references so `brandAssets.logo.src` points to a file that exists at runtime under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` (keep the public `/assets/...` URL form used by the app).

Verify the hero background image reference resolves to a valid static asset path and does not produce 404s (ensure it matches the file placed in `frontend/public/assets/generated/shams-al-qamar-hero-bg.dim_1920x1080.png`).

Add the generated logo asset to the public folder so it is served at `/assets/generated/saq-logo-clean.dim_512x512.png` (source asset already exists in the repo under `generated/saq-logo-clean.dim_512x512.png`).

Add the generated hero background image to the public folder so it is served at `/assets/generated/shams-al-qamar-hero-bg.dim_1920x1080.png` (source asset already exists in the repo under `generated/shams-al-qamar-hero-bg.dim_1920x1080.png`).

Add the generated cleaned gallery photo asset so it is served at `/assets/generated/IMG-20260205-WA0002-1-clean.dim_1600x1200.jpg` (source asset already exists in the repo under `generated/IMG-20260205-WA0002-1-clean.dim_1600x1200.jpg`).

Add the generated cleaned gallery photo asset so it is served at `/assets/generated/IMG-20260205-WA0003-1-clean.dim_1600x1200.jpg` (source asset already exists in the repo under `generated/IMG-20260205-WA0003-1-clean.dim_1600x1200.jpg`).

requirements.summary: Rename the navigation/footer label from “Gallery” to “Portfolio” while keeping the `/gallery` route and keeping the gallery UI behavior (tabs/lightbox) unchanged.
acceptanceCriteria: Header navigation shows a "Portfolio" link that navigates to `/gallery`.
Footer quick links show "Portfolio" and navigate to `/gallery`.
The `/gallery` page remains accessible directly via URL and continues to function with category tabs and lightbox behavior unchanged.

file_operations.description: Update the primary navigation label from "Gallery" to "Portfolio" while preserving the existing path `/gallery` for both desktop and mobile navigation.
Update the footer quick link label from "Gallery" to "Portfolio" while preserving the existing link destination `/gallery`.

Update the visible page heading to a user-friendly "Portfolio" (while keeping the route at `/gallery`) and set a clear document title for SEO (e.g., "Portfolio | ...") without changing tab filtering or lightbox behavior.

requirements.summary: Provide a direct portfolio link UX in-app (origin + `/gallery`) to share as the portfolio URL after deployment.
acceptanceCriteria: A publicly accessible deployed site URL is produced.
A direct portfolio URL ending in `/gallery` is produced and loads the portfolio page successfully.

file_operations.description: Create a small UI block that computes the direct portfolio URL using the runtime site origin plus `/gallery`, displays it as a clickable link, and offers a copy-to-clipboard action (client-side only; no authentication).
Wire the new `PortfolioDirectLink` component into the `/gallery` page near the header so users can easily copy/share the direct portfolio link.
